group_1.narration: “This way, Juri the Great's problem of penting up@magic power out of stress was somehow kept in @check, thanks to the efforts of Yuna and that girl.”
“However, it never rains but it pours.@The signs were already there back then…”
“In the end, I had no unifying power.@That was the problem.”
“Nope, the problem’s been all inside@Juri the Great from the start.”

group_1.textCenter: Well then, would you say that this is the@right set piece for our next songfest?

group_1.textLeft: It’s the best one, I believe,@and it has the most votes.

group_1.textRight: “The Moldau”, it's so majestic and beautiful.@I love the way it makes you feel.
(Can't we just get this over with…?)

group_1.textLeft: Well, now that we've decided on “The Moldau”,@shall we move on to dividing up the parts?

group_1.textRight: Are all of you really sure that you are okay@with that piece?
I completely understand the musical value@and the worth of a mixed chorus,
but given the current state of affairs@and the changing times,
in my humble opinion, it’ll be better to select@a piece that reflects the times a little more.
(There goes that chick again.@Pisses me off.)
Maybe our decision was a bit too quick.@Let’s talk about it a little more.
(No, you guys have made up your minds@for your own reasons…)
Yo, don’t be such pushovers.@At least talk back a bit!
What? The fuck d’you mean "problem", bitch?@Obviously anyone who takes issue with your@HUMBLE opinion’s got a problem, huh?

group_1.textLeft: Miss Ooba, watch your language,@and try not to be rude, okay?

group_1.textRight: (I’m the issue here?!)
Tch…
Hey, Juri. Would you mind joining us for lunch?
You know, since you’re always by yourself.

group_1.textLeft: I don’t got no problem with eating alone, is all.

group_1.textRight: Then, may we use the chairs around you?
Thanks for offering your opinion earlier.

group_1.textLeft: Nah, it’s pointless. You guys still ended up@changin’ the music to cater to that chick anyway.

group_1.textRight: I mean, it wasn't like we absolutely@had to sing that one.
Besides, if we were to be strangely persistent,@it would upset the rest of the class.

group_1.textLeft: Not to mention,@it might worry our teacher too.
Although half of me was kind of disappointed by@how you backed down then, half of me was relieved.
You guys are sure pros at your goody-goody act.@While school's in session, anyway.
(…The heck, they're satisfied with just smiling thoughtlessly and playing along…)

group_1.narration: Don't rock the boat. Keep the peace.@Every goddamn word they say@pisses me off more…

The students who bury their own thoughts to suck@up to those with power. And the teachers who get@off on it. One big house of cards, made of bullshit…@The kind of empty bullshit that pisses me off@ to no end.
Alphas that won't speak their mind,@and Betas that never call them on it.@Hollow-ass whipped dogs, every one…@Fucking losers…
And the biggest fucking loser of all?@Me, for seeing it all and not doing@a goddamn thing about it!
Once the fire starts,@I’ll go back to the same old frenzy and the rest’s@history. Just thinking about it makes me doubt my@self-control!@My old man’s gonna be in trouble again…

group_1.textCenter: (What the hell is this feeling…@This weirdass fuzzy sensation that lingers… )

group_1.textRight: I can give you a hand, if you don’t mind.

group_1.textLeft: Seriously?@You’re… from the same damned school…?

group_1.textRight: Not only that, I’m one grade above you, too.

group_1.textLeft: As old as Yuna, huh…@Didn’t know that…
